ThermalSolutionAxiStatic

class pyrit.solution.ThermalSolutionAxiStatic(description: str, temperature: ndarray, axi_mesh: mesh.AxiMesh, tri_axi_nodal_shape_function: shapefunction.TriAxisymmetricNodalShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations)

Bases: StaticSolution

The solution of a stationary heat conduction problem in axisymmetric coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is ThermalProblemAxiStatic.

The solution of a stationary heat conduction problem in axisymmetric coordinates.

Parameters

  • description (str) – A description of the problem.

  • axi_mesh (AxiMesh) – A mesh object. See pyrit.mesh.AxiMesh.

  • tri_axi_nodal_shape_function (TriAxisymmetricNodalShapeFunction) – A shape function object. See pyrit.shapefunction.TriAxisymmetricEdgeShapeFunction

  • regions (Regions) – A regions object. See pyrit.regions.

  • materials (Materials) – A materials object. See pyrit.materials.

  • excitations (Excitations) – An excitations object. See pyrit.excitation.

Computes the absolute field.

ignore_for_saving = ['_temperature_gradient', '_temperature_gradient_abs', '_heat_flux_density', '_heat_flux_density_abs', '_thermal_conductivity_per_element', '_thermal_loss_power', '_thermal_loss_power_density', '_thermal_loss_power_in_regions', '_divgrad_matrix_lambda', '_load_vector_thermal', '_temperature_gradient', '_temperature_gradient_abs', '_heat_flux_density', '_heat_flux_density_abs', '_thermal_conductivity_per_element', '_thermal_loss_power', '_thermal_loss_power_density', '_thermal_loss_power_in_regions', '_divgrad_matrix_lambda', '_load_vector_thermal']

List of attributes that are not saved

property temperature: ndarray

The temperature. These are the coefficients for the basis functions.

property temperature_gradient: ndarray

The temperature gradient. Array with two values per mesh element.

property temperature_gradient_abs: ndarray

Absolute value of the temperature gradient. Array with one value per mesh element.

property thermal_conductivity_per_element: ndarray

The thermal conductivity. Array with one value per mesh element.

property heat_flux_density: ndarray

The heat flux density. Array with two values per mesh element.

property heat_flux_density_abs: ndarray

The absolute value of the heat flux density. Array with two values per mesh element.

property divgrad_matrix_lambda: coo_matrix

The divgrad matrix for the thermal conductivity.

property load_vector_thermal: coo_matrix

The load vector of the problem.

property thermal_loss_power_density: ndarray

The thermal loss power density. Array with one value per mesh element.

property thermal_loss_power: float

The thermal loss power.

thermal_loss_power_in_regions(*region_ids: int) → float

Compute the thermal power loss in certain regions.

Parameters

region_ids (int) – Region IDs of the regions to compute the energy in.

Returns

energy – The energy

Return type

float

:raises ValueError : When the region of one ID is not two-dimensional.:

static absolute_field(field: ndarray)

Computes the absolute field.

Parameters

field (np.ndarray) – The field. A (N,2) or a (2,N) array.

Returns

absolute_field – The absolute value of the field. A (N,) array.

Return type

np.ndarray

:raises ValueError : When the input array is not of one of ht expected shapes.:

initialize_attributes()

Initialize the protected attributes needed for the properties.

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → Solution

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) – The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution – A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Path

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) –

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) – A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path – The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

classmethod solution_from_problem(description: str, problem: StaticProblem, solution: ndarray) → StaticSolution

Create a static solution from a static problem.

Parameters

  • description (str) – Description of the static solution.

  • problem (StaticProblem) – A static problem.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution of the static problem.

Returns

static_solution

Return type

StaticSolution

solution_identifier: str = 'General static solution'

Identifier for the __repr__ method.
